title: Ecommerce DTC Video Editor
job_overview:
We're looking for a creative, long-term video editor to craft high-quality ad creatives for our eCommerce brand. You'll focus on storytelling, pacing, and editing styles that range from organic UGC-style content to more direct-response, VSL-style videos.

???? Key Responsibilities
???? Edit UGC and raw footage into compelling, high-converting direct response ads
???? Use platform-native editing techniques: quick cuts, dynamic captions, and punchy hooks
???? Collaborate closely with our creative team to iterate based on performance data

???? Requirements

Experience & Skills:
? 1+ year editing videos for performance-based marketing
? Portfolio showcasing UGC-style or native platform ad creatives
? Solid grasp of direct response fundamentals: strong hooks, retention tactics, and CTAs
? Ability to follow briefs while also contributing creative ideas

Software Proficiency:
? Proficient in CapCut, Adobe Premiere Pro, or similar editing tools
? Able to work efficiently with quick turnarounds
? Familiar with AI tools like ElevenLabs, HeyGen, or Kling for voiceovers and avatars

Bonus Experience (Nice to Have):
? Experience with VSL-style or longer-form ads
? Understanding of creative testing, iterations, and optimizing based on ad performance

???? Pay Structure & Workload
This role starts as part-time with flexible hours (typically 15–25 hours/week). If we’re a great match and you consistently deliver strong work, you’ll have the opportunity to move into a full-time role (40+ hours/week) with steady income and performance-based bonuses.

Compensation:
???? Up to $12/hour full-time (depending on experience & speed)
???? Performance Bonuses: $50–$150 for creatives that scale to $1k–$10k ad spend at 2.0+ ROAS

???? How to Apply
If you're a performance-focused editor who knows how to craft conversion-optimized videos, we’d love to hear from you.

Please include:
???? Your portfolio or links to relevant work
???? Your expected rate for part-time (15–25 hours/week) and full-time (40+ hours/week)
???? A list of the tools and software you’re confident using

???? Important: Be sure to include the word “Almond” in your application so we know you read the full post!
